input.name: __VIEWSTATE

p.span: Per Governor Mike DeWine’s recent announcement, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. All Bellbrook-Sugarcreek school buildings and grounds are closed through at least Friday May, 1 with students returning no earlier than Monday May, 4. This information is as of April 3Q and is subject to change. There will be no assignments during our regularly-scheduled spring break (March 30-April 3). We will utilize Google Classroom and email to communicate assignments and information.

As of April 6, we will utilize the Remote Learning Schedule that can be found at the bottom of this page. Like you, we are learning the information in real-time as to how we are all to be affected and why these steps need to be taken. Patience and communication is paramount and we are doing our best to make sure we are prepared, informed and protecting our children and each other. Continue to check this page and your email periodically to ensure that you are up to date.
Simple ways to protect yourself and your family include:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Do not share food, drinks or eating/drinking utensils.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline
list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Cough or sneeze into an elbow or use a tissue and place immediately in the trash.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 13.5pt; color: #272727; vertical-align: baseline

p.span: Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces

nformation from the Ohio Department of Health regarding the COVID-19. We will continue to be in contact with our local and state departments of health in order to follow their guidance and recommendations. More information on the coronavirus is also
If you have questions that are directly related to the closure, please direct all questions to
and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
Thank you for your continued support in keeping our students, staff and community safe.
